binaryOption.toolTip: When software trigger is selected, writing 1 to this field resets and restarts the counter. \n Writing 0 to this field has no effect. Reading this field yields 0
This field is set when the counter value is equal to the IDLY register. Writing zero clears this field

Writing 1 to this bit updates the internal registers MOD, IDLY, CHnDLYm, DACINTx,and POyDLY from their buffers.
 The new values will take effect according to the load mode (LDMOD).
 It can only be set when PDBEN is already set, or at the same time as setting PDBEN.
 It will remain set until the internal buffers are loaded into the registers or until the PDB is disabled.
 Writing 0 has no effect.

bitfieldOption.toolTip:
Indicates a sequence error was detected on pre-trigger from the PDB channel.
 ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n.
 While this conversion is in progress, a new pre-trigger m from the PDB channel cannot be
 accepted by ADCn.
 If this occurs then ERR[m] is set.
 Write 0s to clear the sequence error flags.
The CF[m] bit is set when the PDB counter matches the pre-trigger delay (CHnDLYm+1).\n Write 0s to clear these bits

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects the trigger input source for the PDB.\n The trigger input source can be internal or external (EXTRG pin),\n or the software trigger

choice.name: FTM0 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
FTM1 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
FTM2 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs
FTM3 Init and Ext Trigger Outputs

binaryOption.description: Enable use of Seconds for time
binaryOption.toolTip: Use of floating point is necessary to support specifing PDB times in seconds in runtime code.\n If not needed, the overhead can be avoided by disabling this option

intOption.toolTip: This can be used to ensure that a reasonable resolution is available when using Seconds\n Attempting to set too small a modulo will result in an error

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects when to load the MOD, IDLY, CHnDLYm, INTx, and POyDLY registers,\n after 1 is written to LDOK

choice.name: Registers loaded when PDB counter reaches MOD
Registers loaded on trigger input event
Registers loaded when PDB counter reaches MOD or on trigger input event

binaryOption.toolTip: This bit enables the sequence error interrupt\n When this bit is set, any of the channel sequence error flags generates a sequence error interrupt

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects the clock configuration used for ticks and time calculations
The PDB input clock is divided by this factor

choiceOption.description: Clock prescaler is calculated from given period

floatOption.toolTip: PDB clock frequency (Tick rate of PDB)
PDB clock period (Tick period of PDB)

intOption.toolTip:
Controls the period of the main PDB counter [0..mod]
 When the counter reaches this value, it will be reset back to zero.
 If the PDB is in Continuous mode, the count begins anew
 Counter modulus is (mod+1).
 This register is internally buffered, and any values written to the register are internally buffered.
 The value written is loaded into the actual register only after 1 is written to the SC[LDOK] bit.
Contains the current value of the counter.

choiceOption.toolTip: Selects the action taken when the timer reaches the interrupt delay value

intOption.toolTip:
Specifies the delay value to schedule the PDB event.
 It can be used to schedule an independent interrupt or DMA at some point in the PDB cycle.
 If enabled, a PDB event is generated, when the counter is equal to the IDLY.
 This register is internally buffered, and any values written to the register are internally buffered.
 The value written is loaded into the actual register only after 1 is written to the SC[LDOK] bit.

title.toolTip: Each channel has a number of pre-trigger outputs that are usually associated with an ADC.\n Each pre-trigger is asserted once during a PDB cycle.

choice.name: Pretrigger asserts 1 clock + delay after trigger
Back-to-back, pretrigger asserts 2 clocks after previous acknowledge

intOption.toolTip: Specifies the delay value for the pre-trigger of corresponding channel.\n Only needed for delayed trigger

category.toolTip: Each DAC trigger is associated with a DAC\n Each DAC trigger has an independent counter so may be asserted multiple times within a PDB cycle\n This may, for example, be used with the DAC FIFO to produce multiple levels synchronized to the PDB cycle.

choiceOption.toolTip:
_Disabled
 No DAC trigger is generated
 _Periodic
 DAC interval counter is reset and counting starts when a rising edge is detected on
 selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1
 _External
 DAC interval counter is bypassed and DAC external trigger input triggers the DAC interval trigger

choice.name: DAC periodic trigger using interval counter
DAC trigger is connected to external trigger

intOption.toolTip:
Specifies the interval value for DAC interval counter.
 When the DAC interval counter is equal to this value, the DAC is triggered and
 the interval counter is reset and may continue counting.
 Note that the DAC interval counter is separate to the PDB counter.
 This allows multiple DAC events in a PDB cycle.

category.toolTip: The pulse output is usually used to control the sample window for an associated CMP.\n The pulse is generated once per PDB cycle and has adjustable start and end times.

intOption.toolTip: Pulse-Output goes high when the counter is equal to the dly1

floatOption.description: Pulse-Output Delay 1 - rising edge in seconds

intOption.toolTip: Pulse-Output goes low when the counter is equal to the dly2

floatOption.description: Pulse-Output Delay 2 - falling edge in seconds
